Reviews.Content: Cool little hotel, good location in Florence This is a nice little place, location is the best thing about it. It's about 300 m from the Duomo, and 200 m from the Accademia gallery (home of Michaelangelo's David). Makes it easy to get to the Accademia line-up early in the morning. It's a bit too far from the central train station to walk with luggage, however. Breakfast was decent, the room was fine, we had a few mosquitos in there with us, however.
Reviews.Author: DavidS13

Reviews.Content: Don't judge a book by its cover Stayed here for two nights on our 17-day Rick Steves' Italy tour. After the lovely hotels in Varenna, the Dolomites, and Venice, we were a bit put off by the scaffolding, lack of a nice hotel sign, the ordinary looking street, and the somewhat forbidding-looking entry area of the building. The hotel itself is one flight up and when we got upstairs we found a helpful staff, a clean room, and a quiet environment. The breakfast room was pleasant and had it been a bit warmer we could have taken our breakfast on a nice terrace. Breakfast selection was just fine. The big plus of this hotel is that it is just steps away from the Accademia and the Uffizi, as well as what must be the best gelato place in Italy (Grom--ask at the hotel for directions). Also nearby is Trattoria Za-Za in the Piazza del Mercato Centrale where we enjoyed one of our most fun dinners of the trip. And for good, cheap eats at lunch, try Ristorante Leonardo, a self-service place on Via de Pecori down the street from the Duomo.
Reviews.Author: SoLucky2Travel

Reviews.Content: Modest Amenities Great Location Being approximately 200 m from the Duomo, Hotel California is well located. The Academia is on the same street and a mere 100m away, if at all. Finding it is not too hard considering the unlit neon sign on the facade of the buiding, however, construction scaffolding right in front of it camouflaged it a bit. The entrance is somewhat nondescript as you must ascend to the 2nd floor via the stairway or lift, after which opens up the lobby. The staff are not the most gregarious personalities but will answer all questions when asked. Our room was spacious with a balcony to the inner coutyard, where we would relax after many hours of walking, and the restroom was spacious as well. The bath tub was a bit of an inconveience I must say as it did not have a wall-fastened shower head. Breakfast consisted of eggs, a variety of fruits (Kiwis, Strawberries, bananas, apples) and the usual pastries/breads. Also, a coffee/espresso/capucino machine makes it possible to load up multiple times on cofee. I musn't forget to add one can eat to ones heart's content free of charge. The beds are not the best but we slept solidly. All in all, for the price, Hotel California is a good place to stay and will return here in the future.
Reviews.Author: travelerusc

Reviews.Content: Nice place, great location! This hotel is in a great central location! The Galleria delle Academe is right down the street with the Uffizi a few streets away. The rooms are very clean and the staff is very helpful. We spent three nights here and would have stayed for longer if we didn't have to leave. One of the downsides is using the internet is a bit overpriced at three euros for 1/2 hr. Although the entrance doesn't signal nice hotel, once you get to the top (via lift) you will not be dissapointed. We would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: mydenoree

Reviews.Content: Decent but wouldn't stay there again We recently stayed 4 nights in this Hotel chosen based on TripAdvisor ratings. It wasn't a bad experience, but I don't think the Hotel deserves the rave reviews others have given.It is in a really central location and not so difficult to find, though having to buzz to get in the locked gate every time you go in and out is a bit off-putting. The room itself was very large with a nice balcony, but the bathroom was really tiny. Our toilet flusher button was broken, and the hair dryer falling apart.The staff was nice enough, but need to learn to knock before opening the doors! I don't know if this is common, but our sheets were not changed for the duration of our stay, though they brought clean towels daily.Being a tile floor (no carpet), the floors are a bit dirty. After showering, by the time you walk back to your luggage and put on socks your feet are kind of covered with lint and dust, no big deal but kind of icky feeling.As is common, the queen bed are 2 twins pushed together, but these particular ones didn't want to stay together, and the pillows were very uncomfortable. The church bells of the Duomo make sleeping past 7am impossible, but that isn't the Hotel's fault.All in all, I guess based on this website's advice I was expecting more so was more let down than I would have been if I had no expectations.
Reviews.Author: Jaeded07

Reviews.Content: surprusingly enjoyable when we saw the entrance we thought uh-oh! this does not look good. but ignore the entrance. Although not very modern the rooms were nice, air-conditioned,very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was fine, the staff were lovely. Friendly, comfy, cosy place, and very good value for what we paid. location could not be better, so central. We will stay here if we return, which we hope to do in the near future. so much to see and this hotel will do us. sure it's not luxury but it's good. not sure about noise, can't remember, I always bring earplugs wherever I go. And i don't remember any great problem. Great value.
Reviews.Author: anne2000

Reviews.Content: Wonderful place I've been to Florence a few times before but this time I had only one night there. I wanted something not too expensive, quiet, and close to the city center. Hotel California was all this and more. The owners were very nice and helpful about everything. They've recently done a major refurbishing and everything is new and good-looking. The room was small, but that's all I wanted, and inside it was very nice, spotlessly clean, and with nice fixtures. Lovely roof terrace where you can take a glass of wine. Very close to the Duomo, etc., but off on a reasonably quiet street. A good find, I say.
Reviews.Author: strummer2

Reviews.Content: Friendly and good location Stayed here in October 2005. Two singles and had good sized rooms - city singles usually are very small - with decent bathroom including walk in shower. Looked into internal courtyard that was nothing to write home about.The hotel is on the first floor so the entrance to the street appears uninspiring but what matters is the reception proper which includes sofas where you can sit and have a drink. Staff friendly and helpful.The hotel is central and it is but a few minutes to the Duomo (hence was able to take early morning photos before any tourists were abroad) and also a few minutes to see David. It is easy to walk to the hotel from the station - wheelie suitcase. Plenty of restaurants in the vicinity.Breakfast room is light and airy and was included in the rate. Not the best I've ever seen but provided a sufficient range for a four day stay.Overall a good choice.
Reviews.Author: CultureVultureCamb

Reviews.Content: Messed up or reservation We booked weeks in advance but arrived late afternoon (4 ish) due to train poroblems, only to find they had made a mistake with our reservation and given away our room. I didn't really belive their explanation of having not written it in the book, or some such. They did make us a coffee while they made arrangements to bring our luggage to another hotel run by the same concern, Hotel Colomba, on the next block. As we were dog tired from train travel for 10 hours, we were not very happy. The hotel they brought us to, Hotel Colomba, felt depressing and our room, though large and clean, really looked and felt like a dorm room. Very disappointing.
Reviews.Author: vlopresto

Reviews.Content: Saved our Vacation!! We booked our stay at Hotel California on the day we arrived in Florence thanks to our other hotel losing our reservation. What a God send! When we arrived the proprietor was extremely friendly, he gave us a map of the city pointed out all the places of interest and gave us background on what we might want to see. He told us about museum times and great restaurants (we went to two of them and loved them both). The room was very comfortable - the only thing I will say is that the shower was a little small (but this seemed to be the case everywhere we went in Italy). The breakfast was above average (and includes use of a wonderful cappucino machine). There is also an internet point set up in the reception area - which was very handy. The location is also perfect, only a block or so away from Michaelangelo's David and a short walk from the Duomo. Do be aware that when you first walk up to the building it doesn't look like much, but the hotel reception is on the second floor and it is a wonderful establishment through and through.
Reviews.Author: j_cmccallum

Reviews.Content: Disappointing The hotel is close to all historic sights. However, when you first come to the front door of the building, it seemed as if you were entering a warehouse. The entrance to the building is dark and dirty. There's a small sign that says to ring the bell to gain access behind a gate. The room though spacious for the 5 of us, needed an overdue painting. It also had a foul smell in it. Not a place to stay when visiting Florence for the first time. My travel agent was advised.
Reviews.Author: 5vacationers

Reviews.Content: Highly recommended This hotel has the perfect location. If you walk out the door and turn to your right, you're a block away from see David. If you turn to the left coming out the door, you are heading straight for the beautiful Duomo. This hotel has a small elevator that takes you up to a very nice lobby. The staff was excellent. You could purchase beer, wine, soda and snacks right in the lobby. A can of Heinekin was 2 euro. And it was icy cold, and they also provided ice for your soda's....which is pretty rare in Italy. The rooms were very nice as were the bathrooms. Very clean. Also they had a terrace you could go sit and have a drink at night...very nice. The only drawback was, they did not want to take my Visa travelers cheques. Then they said they would, but charged me a 10 euro fee for using them to pay the bill. The staff was very helpful in anything we asked. They recommended the Yellow Bar for us to have a meal and to watch the World Cup game, telling us that there is an older Italian lady that makes homemade pasta right in the restaurant. We saw her in her own little space making it. I had the gnocci and it was the best I ever had. This hotel was perfect...the location was great, the rooms were nice and the staff were helpful and friendly. I'd highly recommend the Hotel California. If I go back to Florence, I'll definitely be staying there.
Reviews.Author: barbaradt

Reviews.Content: Great hotel Really nice, clean hotel with very helpful staff. We left our passorts behind at another hotel in Rome, and they bent over backwards to get our passorts forwarded to us by the next morning (a Saturday), taking care of calling the other hotel and making all the arrangements to get a courier service to get them to us quickly.The rooms were great too, had a view of the Duomo. Hotel is on the same street as the Academy with the statue of David (within a hundred yards) and very close to the Duomo. They made reservations for the Academy and the Uffizi for us too, which really helped with no queues to get in.Hotel is on the first floor (lift) and only on a single level, so don't let the entrance put you off, typical Italian, all of the beauty is inside, away from the street exterior.Would definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: dmurphy_58

Reviews.Content: OK, but some downsides We stayed at the Hotel California in September 2005. We got a room which looked out over the street, despite requesting a room with a view of the Duomo. We booked about 3 weeks in advance, so it may not have been long enough in advance to secure a room with a view, but the hotel did not even acknowledge our request. You can't always get the best rooms - however, the window in our room was broken and old which meant it didn't shut properly and only provided a poor and inadequate barrier to the noise from the street at night - which kept us awake. The room was also very dark, with little natural light. The bathroom was good, and the room was clean. The breakfast was also very good, and the location was excellent for exploring Florence.
Reviews.Author: pedro1

Reviews.Content: Very nice We found the Hotel California to be very clean and run by very nice  helpful people. We didn't get a bathroom or a bedroom that looked like the ones on the website. But for our next stay we will be sure to ask for what we were seeing. The rooms are not soundproof at all and during our stay there were lots of school age children there who were very rowdy, so we heard everything they said  did. Other than that all was very nice!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Solid I liked this very clean, friendly, family-run hotel. The only downside was very thin walls and somewhat older facilities.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great View       View of Duomo from Hotel California
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Couldn't wait to check out The only thing going for this hotel is the location and hot water. Also, the staff are pleasant enough, and the lobby looks fine.But I found our room depressing. The walls are in desperate need of a paint job, the mattress looks long overdue for replacement, and the furniture is mostly thrift store quality. The dresser drawer had a pile of trash in it, including 2 used condoms (sorry, but it's true). The bathroom was so small I had to think twice about how to get into it and close the door behind me.But the worst of all was the mosquitoes. Even in May, Florence (or maybe just this hotel) was full of mosquitoes. We were eaten alive every night. We would have shut the windows (there are no screens on them), but it was hot and muggy in the room and management had the air conditioning system turned off. Every morning we woke to a new round of mosquito bites.The breakfast is pretty terrible except for the yogurt and fruit. Overall, staying at this hotel put a cloud over our trip to Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Location You cannot go past this hotel for it's location, just near the Duomo and the Acedemia (for Michaelangelo's David - no queues unlike the Iffizi). The room was good sized and the bathroom modern and clean. Breakfast was the typical minimal continental that you find in cheap European hotels. We paid 100 Euros per night in October which was good value for this location.
Reviews.Author: Colman

Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel ( We had a 3-night stay at the Hotel California last week. The location is ideal, between the Accademia and Duomo, and there's a decent grocery store about a block away. Don't be put off by the funky gate and dingy elevator on the ground floor; the hotel is immaculately clean, beautifully furnished and gave us one of the better breakfasts of our trip. We found the staff friendly and helpful--including making sure they had someone at the front desk to check us out at 5 a.m., and get us a cab to the airport. There were students in residence while we were there (though this bunch seemed to be high-school age, not college). We found they weren't troublesome as long as we finished breakfast by 8 a.m., when they tended to invade en masse. Since many of the major sites in Florence open at 8:15 a.m., you'll probably want to be up and out that early anyway.It also helped that we had a room at the far end of the hotel (numbers 120 and up). The students seem to be housed together in rooms numbered 114 and lower. Our traveling companions were in room 115 and were bothered somewhat by noise from the student rooms, but we didn't hear a peep in our room (plus we had a fabulous view of the Duomo from the little balcony). So the upshot is, given the location and quality of the hotel it's a bargain for the price, and the students were minimally troublesome. I wouldn't bypass the California just because of their presence, but if you're bothered by noise you might want to make sure to get a room further down the hall, just to be on the safe side.
Reviews.Author: TreGatta

Reviews.Content: Great Deal We stayed at Hotel California from Nov 11-15, 2004. This hotel is a great deal. It's not super expensive but you get a wonderful location, service  room. We requested a room with the view of the Duomo  got one, room #23, which is pictured in all the brochures. The view was great, a tiny little balcony. The room was decent sized, with a thermostat, brand new bathroom with a good shower. Very clean  comfortable. In the morning, they serve breakfast, which is included, which has yogurt, rolls w/cheese  ham, eggs, juice, coffee, tea, fruit, croissants, etc. The hotel is located on the second floor of a building, you can take a tiny elevator. It's located a block from the academia  a block from the Duomo. Everything is within 5-10 minute walking distance. Great restaurants  bars as well. The room also includes a safe, a TV (which we couldn't figure out how to work so we didn't watch it), telephone, hair dryer (which i suppose is the standard in other hotels, but is completely inefficient at drying your hair). Overall, I'd highly recommend it, it was super convenient.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: a great little hotel We had a wonderful time here - the rooms were fine, some quite large. Stay away from room 101, however - it's tiny and noisy. My single had a little balcony, facing the interior. The only noise I heard were the bells of the Duomo. Others in our party had large doubles. The bathrooms were new and very clean. This hotel is 1 1/2 blocks from the Duomo and 1/2 block from the Academie (David) - a great location! Breakfast was OK, fruit, pastries, coffee, etc. and you could purchase wine, soda and water from the front desk at incredibly cheap prices (1 EU for a glass of OK wine). BTW, there were no students staying there while we were there (October 2004).
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel now houses 65 college students studying in Florence I recently returned from Florence, and, I am sad to report, the Hotel California is now housing 65 college students in 6-week intervals while they study Italian at a nearby institute. I have stayed here several times in the past two years, and I was always pleased with the room and the kind staff. However, this visit was totally different. I stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of my trip, and the 3 girls next door kept me up all night with their talking and loud noice. At breakfast, the formerly charming (and quiet!) breakfast room is overrun with the college kids. I asked at the desk about the deal with all the students, and they didn't really want to answer what was going on. I left Florence for a week, and, before leaving, I reconfirmed my room for 3 additional nights at the end of my trip. To make a long story short, when I arrived back in Florence, the man at the desk told me that he only had one room left, a terrible single on the street side. When I protested that I had made my initial reservations for a double room with quiet location three months in advance, he merely shrugged his shoulders and said, well, we have the students now. I said thanks, but no thanks. He did call several hotels for me, but it caused me to lose an entire afternoon moving to a new, sight unseen hotel. Later, I found out that they had given my room to some additional students. I have no problem with them housing college students, but they should really stop trying to advertise themselves as a hotel.
Reviews.Author: imperialtopaz

Reviews.Content: good hotel, friendly staff Very friendly staff. Room booked not available first night (this also happened to us a few days later in Venice!) However we arrived very late and didn't really notice. Next day we were moved to a lovely room - looks like the one in the picture. No bath, just a shower but absolutely fine. Hotel is very convenient for sightseeing. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely return
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Comfortable and convenient The arrival at this hotel was rather memorable...though there was a sign identifying the hotel, when you go in the door there is a big iron fence and gate. You have to press the button to call the hotel and they will open the gate when you say you want to check in. (After this first time, they opened the gate for us without our having to identify ourselves...I think this a rather good security precaution, but I was a little taken aback by it). The reception area for the hotel is a couple of stories above ground, and the elevator is REALLY a big necessity if you have bags. It is not a very modern elevator, but you can figure it out.The reception area is just like the pictures, really, but the photographer was a genius in making it look more spacious and fancy than it is. We found the staff to be very nice and helpful. At least 2 of the staffers had VERY good English, and the third person's was really more than adequate. All the staff was friendly and very helpful to us, even making sure we could get a cab at around 4:30 in the morning to the train station!Our room was a good size with a double bed (two twins pushed together), a desk, two nightstands, another small table and 4 (!) straightback chairs. More drawer space would have been useful, but it was really OK. The bath was a good size, with the (apparently requisite) very small shower (no tub). Everything was VERY clean and we found the room very comfortable. Should mention (though apparently it's not uncommon) that the room's electricity to lights and the air conditioning is controlled by insertion of your room key card in a reader just inside the door, so you can't leave lights, TV, AC on when you're out.The terrace area is nice and quiet, if not especially pretty, but there's no view and we found little reason to be there. However, I do recommend you buy sodas, etc. at the reception desk...the price is the best you will find in the vicinity, and they'll give you come goblets and even a little tray to take it all back to your room.Breakfast was not a highlight of our stay...coffee was self-serve from the machine that also gave out hot chocolate (maybe I should have tried that, since the coffee was bad), the eggs were not good, pastries, etc. really not good either.The hotel was only a block or so from the Duomo, and a very few minutes walk to the Accademia. This is an EXCELLENT hotel in terms of location, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a clean, reasonably priced, safe accommodation in a very good location.
Reviews.Author: sharonRaleigh

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and very central This is a great little hotel. Don't be put off by the rather grubby concrete stairs and tiny lift, this hotel is a hidden treasure. our room was large with a balcony, and wonderful marble bathroom with spar bath. The hotel is basic, but is clean and in-expensive with freindly people that speak good english. It is very central to the duomo and other beautiful attractions. we were in florence for our honeymoon and it is a great romantic destination. I would recommend this hotel to all.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not the worst, by any stretch! While I'm sorry the other reviewer had such a lousy time at the Hotel California, I can't possibly agree that it is the worst ever. Not even close. Mind you, it's a 3-star hotel which in Italy means it has a tiny elevator and gives you a boring breakfast. But I found the place above average for the extremely reasonable price: fantastic location a block away from major art sites, easy walking distance to anywhere in historic Firenze, fantastic brand new marble bath with a jacuzzi and seemingly endless hot water, outdoor terrace with tables  chairs, and CNN on the cable tv in the room. All that for a price that's at least U.S.$50 less per night than similar 3-star hotels around historic Firenze. But then all I want in a hotel is a decent bed, lots of hot water, and a location I can reach during the day while touring the area. As for the night life, I met my friends in trattorias  it was fine.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The Worst Hotel Ever I am currently in Florence on the last day of a trip that would have been perfect had it not been for the Hotel California. I booked a Single room for #8364;103 - Room 109, to be more specific. WATCH OUT! The room was no bigger than 10 x 12 feet and had a window that looked out onto...NOTHING. The staff doesn't really have a great grasp of the English language and were unfriendly and extremely un-helpful. Additionally, they sprang a NO GUESTS PAST 12 MIDNIGHT curfew upon us at the last minute - this rule is not posted. When I attempted to bring an old friend into the hotel (NOT my room, mind you) the staff promptly CALLED THE POLICE, without clearly explaining what the curfew/no guests rule was.I am well-traveled and am used to staying in 4 star hotels all over the world, and was shocked at the treatment I got. Do yourself a favor - there are many hotels in this vicinity that offer better service, better prices and larger rooms.Good luck. Florence is beautiful.
Reviews.Author: lass=
